_header: My heart is so plunged in grief
Subjects: Fortune, complaint against; commemorative verse, lovers’; lovers, death of
_description: Complaint against Fortune, or dirge for loss of one’s lady? — one 8-line stanza (with music)

TCD158.First Lines:
My hert ys so plungyt yn greffether may no bran my balyes no
                    bynetyll y onys may sse my leffeit wyll not com owt off my
                    mynd…
TCD158.Last Lines:
…ffor y may nat my lady ffyndy wot y dye for greffe and
                    wo
TCD158.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 151.
